I was looking for a black mask and i found yours on amazon.. the price was very affordable and the fit of the mask just perfect
I love that this mask is entirely black. It is comfortable to wear and also lightweight. Great value for money. I keep some in my car because I always forget or a friend forgets.

I really like these masks because they’re disposable and they’re BLACK. I sometimes wear fabric masks but dislike that I have to constantly wash them. These disposable ones are perfect - wear and throw away. Perfect.

The fibers of the mask too easily shred and come apart.  The ear straps pull very hard. Wearing it for a few minutes the fibers start coming apart and it starts to shred and tickles the inside of your nose.  You go through the masks too easily.  Have to replace very often.  I never write reviews but this mask needs better material.  Sorry for my negativity.  I do like that it’s black.
I like these a lot! I needed some disposable face masks to keep on hand for when I forgot a washable one or all of my others were dirty. This is much more breathable than the blue disposable ones.
After only one hour the material inside the mask was itching my nose and face. If I can't wear it due to itching what good is it!

It is less irritating than the blue and white surgical masks; light weight and and the color makes it professional looking.  The only flaw is was that a few of the bands came off of the masks. Considering the price and the quantity, it is well worth it.

These masks are very comfortable.  I have these in my car as backups and sometimes use them as my primary if my nicer cloth ones are not available.  Definitely think these are nicer than your standard masks.  The nose adjustment is helpful.  Will definitely reorder as needed.
This is a very cheap mask!!!  Do not recommend!!!  Mine went into the trash! Very thin ears lops & is very large / thin.
These are great. They are better than the blue ones because there are no cotton strands that pull apart and annoy me throughout the day. The nose strip also bends really well to form to the face.
They look way better than the blue and white ones in my opinion. Otherwise they compare to other disposable mask.
Fits nicely. The metal around the nose hasnt been missing in any masks and the straps don't break like some others I've bought
I bought these to wear in the gym only and they are perfect. Breathable, durable, no issues with strings breaking off or ripping. Will buy again

Cheappy  product.  Worse, it came with a card  saying I won a prize and to scan the code.  When I did, my phone blocked the site from opening warning me of danger.  I do not recommend this product and suggest Amazon check it out.
These are way too light and I  breath through the fabric normally. Great if you want a fake mask with a side of Covid.

Perfect for what I needed to be using at work. Glad I found these! Most masks are too small on my face. These fit the best out of the many options I’ve previously tried. I will definitely be ordering again.

Really like these masks. I use them for my workouts and they are incredibly comfortable and lightweight. I also like that I can wear them out when I have makeup on and they don’t show the makeup like white masks.
These are my favorite masks! They are comfortable and I was able to keep them on at airport and on 2 long flights with no problem at all!
Great if you only wear it dor a short time. The more you wear it fibers pull apart and make tour nose itch.

Nose Liner came out and tore through the material, some of them before we even took them out of the package.  Had to throw away many of them.  Otherwise loved that they were black and otherwise comfortable.

Pretty good masks, same protection as the regular blue masks. Choose this mask color to take a break from wearing the usual blue mask. This order was delivered pretty quickly considering the rise in covid cases.
These are not gonna do anything for you, cut one open after touching one and feeling iffy and there was no filter or another layer inside...
Me and my husband have been using these masks since summer. Love their design. They do provide good protection too
My favorite since I have to wear them. I will definitely be purchasing again in the future, they are very comfortable, light weight and stretchable fits well.

These lightweight masks are easy to wear and give a great alternative to the more medical ‘blue and white’ masks. I was concerned about colour transfer on to the face but wore these all day with no issues. Comfortable and stylish!
NOT for Covid-19 protection!  I can blow out a candle while wearing this useless mask.  In my opinion opt for something better.  Twenty eight cents does NOT buy you protection.

The upper right point of connection for the elastic just falls right off on first use. I stapled one of them, so in a 50-pack, I've used about 10 or so, and 3 have fallen apart. About half have a mildew smell. Mild, but annoying.
It's a face mask. Disposable. Not medical. I got black for style points because it's cooler than the white ones.
Very good quality mask. I tested them by trying to blow out a flame while wearing the mask and no matter how much I tried I was unable to blow it out.
I like the color more than anything. After some use it felt like some of material comes up and be itchy and irritating. I use the silicone Inserts which works so much better .
These are great. I bought them for my husband and I. They are roomy and don’t crowd my nose. It also allows you to breath. Easy and disposable. Will buy them again.
Nice quality masks for a great price. The black ones look a little more cooler than the normal white ones.
straps break within one or two uses. you can find disposables with a bit more durability. save your money.
It's advertised as coming with a flexible nose grip and it does not.
Some breaks. I don’t get to use it at all. But most of them works good. I like the black. Matches what I wear. Thanks.
The masks fit well. The color looks good and matches what you wear. The material feels quality, and the manufacturing build is good.
Nice masks.  Look better than the hospital blue IMO.  Straps can break, but not often.  They hold up well.
These are more formal looking, and go with almost any colored attired vs its blue generation.  No complaints here.
Still trying to find super-soft disposable masks.  These fit well and have good stretch, but the lining is rough and itchy.
The ear elastics on these are way too big, might fit a larger make or someone with a beard but not an average person. Useless to me.
I just love. The box wasn’t smushed like the other ones I’ve ordered. Packaging was superb and the mask is also of good quality

These masks have the same black shiny finish on both sides, they do not have what appears to be a gray back finish shown in one of the seven photos. This gray layer is actually an inner layer of the mask that you do not see unless you cut the mask open. If you take the mask off without pinching the nose clip, you have no idea which side was facing out or against your skin.

These are by far the worst masks I have ever purchased. There is no lining inside for any protection. They are extremely thin. There is not an inch of protection. I didn't purchase the masks for style. I purchased them to get some form of protection. I feel like I have to wear 5 of them to protect myself. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. YOU WILL END UP RETURNING THEM JUST AS I AM ABOUT TO. This should be a crime!

We bought these and was very dissapointed in them. They feel like single ply and they become soft and don't fit snug in no time. Did not have any confidence in them. We went to our local BJ's Wholesale Club and bought the black ones they are selling and like them 10 times better!
Using these under cloth masks for extra protection. I wish they were a bit larger but are attractive and sturdy.
They are not big enough, could use one with more coverage...though when worn with a fabric mask over it, provides better protection and stays in place.

Massive issue for this product is that for one it is the same color on both sides, if you were to re-wear this product you run the chance of putting on the "infected" side first. Second issue, is that it may be easy to breath with these but the layered protection isn't there. It is like putting a piece of mesh on your face. Sure it does give you coverage, but not really protection. Masks are also very cheaply made.
Unlike other masks, these masks do not itch one's nose and they have plenty of space to breathe. On top of that, the strings stay attached, unlike others. We are staying with this brand for sure!

Super comfortable and breathable material. made well and always gets here quick. Myself, my husband and everyone else in the family has worn them and we all agree. The most important part is that unlike cheaply made masks where the wire over the nose area doesn't contort correctly to the form of you're nose, these do! I've ordered 4 boxes already and they're all consistently made the same.
You really feel protected with these mask. Love the color and they last longer than others. I will recommend my friends.

This is the best disposable mask I've used yet, I recommend this specific one to friends. I still add a metal nose strip when wearing glasses, but without glasses these are good on their own. Breathable.

Comfortable, breathable, and lightweight! I love that it comes in a box that I can reclose and can keep in my car! The black color upgrades your look a lot more and can match with outfits better as well!
Comfortable, breathable and affordable. Love these for everyday. Keep a ziplock of them in car, gym bag and briefcase.
Like the black look. After a days worth of usage the interior starts to wear and the ling develops fiber strands that are incredibly itchy. Can't really use it for more than a day or two.
These are great quality and price, however they caused my chin and mouth area to severely breakout. I don't have sensitive skin, so this was unexpected.

I like the color and how it sits on my face as opposed to some other masks I have tried. It works well for anyone in a pandemic and once done I will resume no longer wearing any face mask again hopefully
Great value, feel sturdier than the White and blue disposable masks I’ve gotten previously. As comfortable as a mask can be.

I’ve been looking for a lightweight mask that also looked good for quite some time. I tried the usual surgical masks and found them to be adequate but these black masks have that little bit of shine as well as comfort that I’m really liking. Highly recommend these.

Two stars given because these masks shed and begin to unravel making it look like you have a fuzzy beard on the outside. They also shed on the inside and you have to pick fuzz out of your mouth. Comfortable, lightweight, and value for your money...sure, but overall, a disaster.

great masks that easily fit all face shapes. the one thing i wish was different was the nose clamp. i’ve had masks with much stronger nose clamps. these tend to un-bend after a little while and i catch myself having to bend it back. still, these are the only masks that my family uses and will continue to use!
These are low key annoying. They have so many fuzzies on the inside!! so i was constantly itchy around my nose and it was just uncomfortable
Arrived quickly. Masks are great. Work in a factory and the black color doesn’t show dirt. Will reorder

The masks are well made. The elastic is comfortable  to wear, and the mold nicely around your nose, the do however have a slight odor, I've removed the from the plastic packaging with the hope the odor will dissipate.

I ordered three boxes of these gloves. When the package originally arrived, we checked the boxes which did not look like they were tampered with. I had no issues with the first box (which is why I am giving three stars), and was almost finished with the second box (a few gloves at the bottom remaining). When I went to use a pair this morning, I discovered that one of the gloves in the box was stained with what looked like a translucent brown liquid that had dried! I threw the rest of the box out!!!!

The gloves are all right, nothing impressive. But, the package arrived damage and the opening is broken. Was it on purpose? How could you crush an actual box this bad during delivery, when delivery bag seems fine but the product looks like someone teared it open. Very disappointed in the arrival condition would not buy again.

This is the worst product. These gloves rip just putting them on & they’re not even tight. I’m very disappointed. I won’t order them again. What’s the point of having gloves if they rip just putting them on. I buy a LOT of gloves, but I won’t buy these again. You have to be so so careful, I don’t want to risk them tearing while I need protection.
Tears easily. Very thin.
I got the gloves with a ripped up box. The outside package was perfectly fine so you can tell it was shipped that way. Since I need to wear them to stay safe from Corona, that doesn’t seem very safe.

I needed clear vinyl gloves for a cooking demo.  It's next to impossible to find them in the store- most don't fit well or come in odd colors.  I have small hands (ring size 4-5) and was concerned about the fit.  As some of the other reviews mentioned the gloves run a little small, I ordered size medium.  They were a perfect fit!  Worked well for food prep and held up to normal use.  Will order again whenever this large box runs out.

That said, they’re fine. I worked in an emergency room and always double glove for infectious diseases. Recommend you do that as well . These are not thick and durable in times when we are trying to practice staying away from the Ovid-19.
Great quality gloves for a great price. They are not thin and they don't easily tear like some other gloves that I have used in the past.

I have a genetic immune disorder so I've been buying medical gloves for years. Usually I buy the blue nitrile ones but they were not available at the time. So I bought these instead. Total mistake. These gloves rip at the wrist every single time I put one on. Only buy these if you are extremely desperate. Appalling that companies can sell such subpar products for medical use. People with immune disorders should get prioritization like hospitals on medical supplies that we have needed for every day life before the pandemic and now even more so.

I have to use gloves for cleaning certain things regardless of covid and these are awful! I can't imagine these are really used in the medical profession. Maybe as a last resort, as in my case. These have some thickness but they rip at the wrist before you can get them all the way on because they have little ability to stretch. They are a bit skinny and the fingers are kind of long, they aren't a true size medium. If I get them on without ripping they almost always roll up around the wrist. I'm pretty annoyed at this purchase because not only are they worst gloves I've ever used, it's price gouging, I'm getting really sick of amazon allowing this on here.

These gloves are on the small side, simply because they do not stretch like nitrile gloves do. However, as long as your hands are totally dry and you slip them on slowly, carefully over the fingers first, then down your hand, they go on well. My husband and adult son are not fond of them because they break when they put them on; I have found them to go on well when I take the time as mentioned above. Yes, I have had a few break on that last pull over my palm but I usually take the time to do it carefully. I ordered more because they are more readily available and a few dollars less than nitrile. I am glad I ordered the medium size though; I have nitrile gloves in small that fit my hand nicely, but these in a small would not have worked at all. So, think about the sizing, one size up, because had I known this before and ordered the XL for my husband and adult son, they might work better for them. I like them for what I need, filling the gas tank, handling certain things from the store, going through the mail; just remember to order a size larger.

Since 2020, my hands have been breaking out in a god awful rash. They start with tiny red itchy bumps, and end up with most of the hand/wrist being covered with severe redness/bumps, that often become flaky or crack and sometimes bleed. I’ve worked in a hospital for almost 9 years, so you can imagine the torture my hands went through, even more so with COVID. From my NP to a dermatologist, both thought my condition was either fungal infection or severe heat rash. I tried fungal, anti-itch, and steroid creams, along with specific creams for eczema and psoriasis- none of which which truly helped. Many months later (and a butt ton of money), I’ve discovered that I’m allergic to Nitrile gloves, which happens to be the only gloves my hospital uses because they’re generally powder and latex free. Since early this year, I’ve been using these gloves at work instead of the Nitrile gloves, and my hands have healed up tremendously! I’ve gone from looking like I’d dipped my hands in acid, to practically normal looking hands again. These gloves aren’t quite as durable as others and can easily rip if applying too much pressure with putting them on, so I went up to a size medium to avoid struggling with putting them on- easy fix! I don’t have a before and after photo of my hands, so you’ll just have to take my word for it. I’ll continue to repurchase these as they alone have saved my hands!!

I have been frustrated trying to find decent gloves ever since Costco ran out of their gloves during COVID-19. The ones Costco carried were perfect with regard to size, and they are (were) sturdy and affordable. These particular gloves from Amazon are quite expensive, and the medium does not fit my hands like the medium size from Costco. Because they are a little on the tight side, getting them on my hands causes them to break with ease. They're just not very stretchy and I have to be very careful with them. And they develop tears fairly easily. I've been using them for painting, and find I need to throw them out and put on a new pair after a couple of hours. I guess I need to continue my search for a better glove. Sigh.

This is 2nd box we've used. Pros: 1. They do the job. 2.  Didn't tear. Cons: Sizing inaccurate -- please see below. Comments: 1. First box was large & fit a male with medium-large size hands, but difficulty getting on & off.  This was likely attributable to the fact that they're vinyl (with inherently little stretch) and powder-less, all as expected.  One shouldn't expect anything different than what one ordered. 2. Second box was for female with TINY hands , conventionally wearing size XS (or small if gloves run tight).  Based on reader reviews, ordered medium and sure glad we did!  While there's room to spare at fingertips & a bit elsewhere, clearly the small would either not fit or be challenging (and therefore tear) if we selected small. 3. Because one must oversize and have room to spare, due to the nature of vinyl, we do NOT recommend vinyl for tasks that require fine detail or good touch sensation.  But this is the nature of the beast, NOT a problem for this glove. Thanks to prior reviewers, and hope this info helps someone else!

I bought these because my mom came home from surgery and I needed a LOT of gloves.  A few issues. 1- I never actually realized I was allergic to latex, but apparently I am.  The box kind of fools you because it says latex free but if you look at it closely it says something about how its "components" are latex (whatever the words they used, there is Latex in these gloves).  My hands have gotten extremely itchy, red, lots of bumps, etc.  All in all:  I hate these gloves. 2- They rip and they rip often.  If you think you're getting these "inexpensive" gloves and "wow look there's so many inside!"  They probably give you so many because they rip so often, usually right around the palm area or right at the wrist.  And yes I bought the right size. 3-  Super duper thin.  Think deli gloves. The really sucky thing?  I bought this box and my medical supply center sent me the same exact ones in another box lol.  So now I am stuck with 2 boxes of these sucky gloves lol.

These gloves were great when I bought them before. I have always used vinyl gloves around the house for various chores --anything handling raw meat, gardening in dirt, to cleaning the cat litter box. I bought and received these last March, but now the price is more than double.

This product came in a torn box and the writing on the box has misspelling of common words which makes me think that this manufacturer didn't even take the time to spell check product packaging they are sending to America.  Makes me suspicious of the quality of these gloves.  Not being paranoid, but they are, of course, from China.  Leads me to think they are not what they say - being protective to use during the Covid19 epidemic.  Anyone else notice this? anyone else got a torn box?
Use it for cleaning job at home daily. It is a good gloves either it’s price or quality but the only thing that I don’t like is the water could permeate easy .

So before ordering I read some of the reviews and the majority were saying to size up because they were too small. Regular “one size fits all” gloves are always way too big on me, I have small hands. So I figured I would size up to a medium (normally I’d think to order small) and these medium are the sizes of one size fits all, they are too loose on me. I like to use these while cooking and these started sliding off, I need to order another set in small or I’ll have to use rubber bands at the wrists everytime to make sure they don’t move around. So just size normal, don’t size up.
Extremely thin and low quality. Breaks just trying to put these on!

COVID purchase. I wanted some inexpensive gloves for shopping trips, and to protect my hands from all the disinfectant wipes and sprays I'm using these days, and for when I'm loading "contaminated" laundry into the washer. I also use disposable gloves to clean up after the pets and handle raw meat and fish. They've served well. I also use nitrile gloves for certain tasks, and for work at my retail job. Using the cheaper vinyl gloves for quick jobs that don't require touch sensitivity helps me conserve the more expensive nitrile gloves for jobs that do. For those who haven't used vinyl gloves: They will fit much more loosely than a nitrile glove of the same size. They tend to cling to your fingernails and eventually (depending on use) start tearing where the nails poke through. Any chunky jewelry will tear them. Pulling them on too hard or with wet hands will tear them, as with disposable gloves of other materials.

These are very cheap gloves, they rip as you are putting them on and if you have finger nails (normal, nothing extravagant) they will rip through the holes. I bought them for my soap making and keeping everything sanitary but these are so thin, it isn’t worth it. I just bought a box of nitrile gloves that Ive used before and they are much tougher. I should have just stuck with those since the price is comparable. Now I have a box of gloves that can’t be used. The size isn’t true to fit either, hence the ripping when trying to get them on. Got a medium which my hand fits fine in other brands and these are probably best for small hands.

I like the gloves. They serve their purpose. But I must say they are way overpriced for a supposedly inexpensive disposable glove. These are the same gloves I used to buy in the 99 cent store for $1.59 before the pandemic. And that was kind of  high price considering the store is named the 99 cent store. That's back when I just used them for cleaning and cooking. Now I used them when I go shopping at the supermarket, pharmacy, etc. in addition to cleaning and cooking. Now they are $9.99 in the 99 cent store which is way too high and $17.99 on Amazon which is way, way too high.

I have small hands, and whenever I buy food prep gloves I always get small or small/medium. I purchased the medium thinking my husband could use them if needed and squeeze into them, but they are tight on my hands. There’s no way he could use these too. Get a size larger than what you’re used too. Like any vinyl gloves they’re pretty durable, but they will tear if you are not careful enough with them when aggressively cleaning that stubborn stain - that’s with any other vinyl gloves I’ve used in the past. Sometimes you need to double up on them.

Returned the vinyl gloves for nitrile gloves from the same manufacturer.  The vinyl gloves tore every time I put one on to use it and it wasn't because of the size.  They just weren't good quality in my opinion. After three torn gloves in a row I decided to exchange them for the ones I was familiar with - MedPrice Nitrile Gloves.  The handling of the return and replacement was fantastic; couldn't be happier with the service and am very pleased with the nitrile gloves.  There is quite a big difference in price from vinyl to nitrile but well worth it for sanitary reasons.

I usually get latex free medical gloves that stretch more. I thought I would try these. I am a woman with fairly large narrow hands, Medium Fit very close to fit of Medium Medical gloves. The fit is very good with short or long nails. They stay put! Work great for gripping things! Thick & strong but flexible. Excellent with phone or tablet... a real bonus for me. I can wash them while on my hands or use hand sanitizer when touching surfaces outside my house to keep from transfer/cross contamination. So one pair can keep me safe all day, then toss away! Very happy with my purchase.

Firstly they fit my hand perfectly but godforbid you move too quickly they will rip at the base before you even slip your hand in. Now, if your working with corrisives then forget it these things have the worst grade of plastic and the thickness can only be measured in picometre. They melt like butter in the microwave if in contact with any strong acid or base. Any type of temperature increase, not even an open flame but warm table top. I am sure you can probably guess the outcome. Stuck plastic to any warm surface. SAVE YOUR MONEY!

During the covid pandemic I have been very glad to have these gloves available especially for the price. I use these gloves to take care of my teenage autistic daughter who needs help with daily living skills. Sometimes they do break and don't have the flexibility of higher end gloves that you would find in a professional health care setting. With that being said, use them accordingly depending upon your needs but be aware that  you might need something different when working with clients for safety.
It breaks easily.

Unfortunately these gloves tear easily. I use gloves a lot when I do different paint-resin-wood crafts/projects, so when I had to purchase another box, I liked these because of the price.  I got Medium and they run a little small and start to tear when trying to pull them on.  Once you've got them on, they serve their purpose with small projects, but if you have to wash your paintbrushes, you'll find yourself with a torn fingertip or two. They also leave a sour "after-smell" on your hands like mildew.

These work for me and keep my hands clean while shopping groceries or filling up with gas at those two nasty places.  Then I just rip them off and wash my hands. I even use them to wash my vegetables with diluted vinegar a natural disinfectant then I take them off and trash them.  Works very good for me.

I wear disposable gloves when taking public transportation which isn't very often these days. I've only worn two pairs of this brand so far so I can't really rate them properly at this point. I am an older female with chubby hands. I can't wear a small size so the medium are perfect for me... just a little on the loose side so they are easy to put on and take off. They are a good thickness but easy to pick up small objects and use a camera. So far, so good!

These gloves are the worst gloves made during this Pandemic and they should be ashamed of themselves! A medium was too small. But my hands aren't large. They didn last one dish washing! And yes, I wash my dishes, it's only me! The fingers were too short and the tips always broke. I kept them because I have skin issues and must keep my hands covered with WELL MADE GLOVES when using my hands! These were the only gloves left on the shelves. I had no choice. They offered a return but I needed something to protect my hands.
These gloves rip as soon as you put them on.  Very poor quality.

Well I can honestly say that I wasn’t too pleased with these gloves. I’ve ordered several from different vendors and these have been the worst yet. I would Like to return them but I just don’t feel like going through the  trouble for a little money. I’m not sure if it’s because they run small that they rip at the top when you’re trying to pull them up or they’re just not thick enough. I ordered medium I wish I would’ve ordered possibly a large but as I said too much trouble to return. I would not order these again. Maybe my review would’ve been different if I would’ve ordered a different size.

These are more like food handler gloves (thin); my box had about 5 defective or stained gloves in it (had holes or were discolored brownish orange stained).  If your hand has any moisture on it, it is VERY hard to get them on.  The bottom of the glove had torn several times while we were trying to put them on.  If your using them to cook, they should be okay but if you need to wear them out... get a different kind.

I am pleased with this product.  I am cleaning a wound my husband has  2x’s daily and these gloves are just what the doctor ordered.  They are easy to get on and off, enable me to apply his medicine and creams without a mess, and fit well. I will definitely purchase again.

I bought these gloves just to do general things around the house such as cleaning the guinea pig. I don’t think it was worth the price, but it was a necessary buy. I think because of the virus, they are Price gouging. However, it seems to be the best price I could find on here. Although there was a box that was a dollar cheaper but I chose these because of the medical company and  the description!! , That’s just what we needed. They work great.
I received an empty envelope - no gloves inside & was charged for them. :(

These gloves have good reviews, but as with all things in our economic system I expect these are outsourced to different firms that have wildly divergent quality control. We bough two boxes, and the ones we got are horrible. I normally fit medium, but these are much too small. For bad sizing I would normally ding a product just a start or two. But the quality of these gloves i also terrible. My wife, who can wear them, has to be very careful not to tear them just putting them on; never mind doing actual work with them. Go ahead and buy them if you like playing roulette. But if you want a 100% guarantee you'll get decent gloves, look elsewhere.

Very disappointing - the second glove that I pulled out of the box ripped when I pulled it onto my hand.  They are not nearly as flexible as the nitrile purple ones from the same company.  They are out of stock right now, so I ordered the clear ones.  I'll use them to clean up messes from my kittens, but will not purchase them again.  Hopefully, the purple ones will become available again.

These are typical vinyl gloves and are perfectly adequate for the usual things that do not require sterility - these are not sterile. Vinyl has its limitations compared to nitrile such as less resiliency and less chemical resistance (acetone and certain other solvents will dissolve these) but it keeps my hands clean and, most important, it's actually available unlike nitrile.
Box arrived crushed with gloves hanging out of it

These gloves tear apart easily if you are using them to do more than just wear. If you're looking for something more durable for applying or giving mediation to your animals as I do, or any other duties, stick to the blue gloves. I can probably use these for grocery or any other shopping I need to do, in which case they work for that just fine.

I am a woman with smaller hands so ordered mediums but should have ordered large, they are a tight fit. They do tend to rip open when pulling them on, even without much force. They’ll work for what I need them for (woodworking crafts with sealers)

We use these gloves for cleaning  and for us they are too thin.  When we put them on the area by the wrist tears and while working we look at the gloves and they get tears at the top of the fingers and between the fingers..  We don't want a glove that's too thick but we want to be able to get them on without and finish the job without tearing.

I have ordered several different types of gloves due to the current Coronavirus and these are not good quality: 1. They are thinner than most other latex gloves and rip easily. 2. Fit is poor as compared to others - tight in the fingers and then loose around the wrist. Hope this helps!

I use the gloves for peeling & seeding peppers.  These work the best of any I have used.  The fit is good, not too tight or loose, makes the job easier, & I don't have to worry about setting my eyes on fire when I remove my contact lens.
As soon as you put these on a hole is torn in the upper part of the glove. Tried it several times with same result. Can still be used but won't re-order. Gloves are very thin.

I was really hopeful for this being that it had 4+ stars, but I should've actually read the reviews. These gloves are cheap for a reason. They break very quickly, like break while you're putting it on quickly. The wrists are oddly too baggy but the rest of the glove fits snugly. Don't waste your money on this one. Spend a little more for another

I bought these gloves hoping to save money and not buy the more expensive medical gloves.  Now I'm regretting buying these.  The are difficult to put on at times, as they want to stick to my skin.  And they also rip easily while putting them on.  I work in a hospital and I don't struggle with the medical gloves at work of the same size.

I am so disappointed in the gloves... They rip to fast and sometime while l am putting them on... it seem if they where old ...dry rotten... something. I was not able to use them for anything .... one or more of the fingers would have a tear/ torn... l just want to wear them for sanitize... look up and my finger is torn.... l keep think some of the gloves would be okay... we’ll not really...

These gloves are a lot thinner then what I expected. I was putting them on and the rim torn very easily not too mention they seem to run a little smaller. I have used others size medium put them.on with no difficulties and with these I struggled  a little.  What I did like, there was no powdered residue.

Every 2nd or 3rd glove would tear as I pulled it on.  Once I was aware of the problem, I was careful to make sure my hands were thoroughly dry, but it would still tear just above the roll at the bottom of the glove.  The gloves were a little large so fit didn't seem to be a problem.  I don't recommend them.

These gloves, although a bit pricey by pre-Covid standards, are worth the extra money. We had been using some crappy gloves from Wal-Mart, that wouldn't stand up to the way we used them, which was demanding. But these gloves, heavy mil, are very durable. I'm not going back to the Wal-Mart ones.

You know when you have to clean something absolutely mankey but don't want to? These make that process a way easier time. I hate taking my bins out, I'm an absolute coomer about it because I find it disgusting to touch bins. Started using these a few years ago and now I'm no longer so repulsed by the experience.
First of all the size, 'Medium' very small. Secondly, every glove that was tried tore very quickly. This is absolutely a rip off.  Lots of luck to all future buyers of this inferior product.

Half the time they break before I can even get them on my hand. There is no stretch to them at all and they are very thin. Usually one or two of my fingers have broken through before the intended task is complete and I don’t have long fingernails at all. I’m very disappointed in these.

These gloves tear almost instantly. I just use them when for protection from Coronavirus. I use talcum powder before trying to put them on because otherwise they almost certainly will treat. Then within a minute or two they will to open between the fingers. They are total garbage

They fit nice, no tearing. I used them with cleaning at home and when I went to grocery stores during this pandemic. I am a Nurse and have a latex allergy, these gloves are perfect. I ordered a box in March 2020, and I am ordering another box now in July. Very pleased with product.

Super gloves! I have to wash them before I use them once they are on my hands because I’m putting warm compresses on an infected eye. They hold up really well! I also like how they come out of the box very gently, one at a time. You don’t tug on one and get six gloves flying out at you.

I use these when getting fuel or having to use a public restroom. So far, they do the job they are intended for. No issues with tearing when putting them on. For the price, these are great for helping maintain a barrier between my hands and possibly contaminated surfaces.

Bought them because they were out of Nitrale Gloves.  Big mistake !  Assisted living where they are changing gloves every time they enter a room.  They do not like them!  They are sitting there not being used even when they had to go to other end of building to get some.  I finally have sub par ones and they still won’t use them .  Definitely won’t get them again.  No Vinyl!

I bought these gloves due to the high review rates. They did not meet the quality I thought they would be.  I would say about every third time I would pull out a set of gloves, one or both would rip.  I will look for other gloves with a little more thickness and do not rip so easily.

These are practical for simple medical tasks at home. They do tear easily especially around the wrist.  They fit me well. One must be careful if rising or water will enter the glove, thus, often requiring a new glove.  Don’t buy them for heavy toil. They won’t hold up to such a task. Good quantity.

I opened the package and was about to put a glove on when I noticed something rolled into the glove. I looked closely and realized I found a worm rolled up into the glove! Another glove had a brown bug! How are these “medical” gloves? So disgusting!!!!!! WARNING TO ANYONE WHO’S BUYING

I've been using these since the "Virus" (Coronavirus/COVID19) has been around.........I have 2 boxes on hand at all times and I do love them......easy on, easy off........throw them away.......I will continue to buy them  until there is no longer a need for them.

Purchased these to use when going to the grocery store and around the house.  When one glove ripped, I didn’t think anything of it.  Then a second glove ripped, again, didn’t think anything about it.  When I pulled these out of the box and they were ripped in advance of my putting them on my hands, I was very disappointed and wanted to let others know that they should be careful when purchasing this product.  It’s a good thing there are 100/package.

They aren't super thin but I've gotten much stronger/ durable gloves recently for a better price.  These tear very easily, especially around the wrist area.  I had to discard probably 1/3 of them because they ripped as I was pulling them on and they were not even tight on my hands.  You can get much better gloves for cheaper!

Definitely not as advertised. Would not buy these gloves again. Way too thin. Putting it on I have to be meticulously careful to do it slowly as they rip very easily. Do NOT recommend. Ive bought other gloves that were better quality and did not rip.

So disappointed in these gloves. They are not durable and they are not the typical medical exam vinyl gloves. I used these gloves to wash dishes and after the first use, they were normally unusable the second time around. Too expensive, not durable and I cannot justify buying them again.

I only wear these gloves once and then discard them due to COVID. They are heavy enough, but the tops of them do not fit close to the wrist and as a result, they tend to fool down. Not my kind of glove to use to protect yourself.

The box was open when I received it, and the tab on top of box you pull back to open was missing,  gloves were hanging out from the end of the box and out the top of box, were they used, did someone taint them or steal some out of box???

I bought these as I was looking for cooking gloves. Medium size for wife and XL for me. I liked them. no spark or anything extraordinary about them. They are gloves and they work or perform as expected. Good product.

The gloves function very well. A great value for the money that I paid. They're not too thick which I like, but maybe other buyers may want more thickness. They feel comfortable in my hands and they don't slip out easily, unless you want them out. I do recommend them.

These gloves are adequate. The prices have gone up on all gloves due to the pandemic but I’m glad to have them. They are thick and durable. The top rolls down a little and they do not fit snuggly. They do get the job done though!

These gloves were a replacement for the black gloves I typically use in the kitchen when I cook... however, since rubber gloves are hard to come by I switched to these. They tear very easily and are snugger than the other medium gloves I typically use.

These things tear as soon as you put them on, I seriously don’t understand the positive reviews! There’s almost zero stretch, and the holes created just trying to get them on make them pointless for caretaking. I stuck them in the bathroom.

My sister is in hospice, my brother in law takes care of her 24/7.  Gloves are an item that hospice doesn't provide.  This was a very good find for him.  He likes the thickness and the ease of putting on and off.  Thank you!!

The gloves I ordered fit very comfortably and feel thick. However, I rip one at least every third time I put a pair on. It would be much more affordable to purchase a better box of gloves because I will end up wasting at least a third of a box.

If I had known this product was made in China, I would not have purchased it. The gloves are cheap looking and I guess that explains why they are not worth having. However, I will use them to clean toilets; I will never buy this product again.

The first 4 gloves I took out of the box ended up in the trash because they tore just trying to get them on my hands.  My hands were completely dry so it should have been easy.  A few more tore easily also so be careful.  The fit is tight and it's the material that isn't very stretchy so I'm sure if I got one size bigger they would be baggy.  Not very comfortable.

I got these to go out into the world. Keep some in my car, purse and by the door. After I take them off, I sanatize my hands and throw them in the trash can. I do not want the Covoodies and am an over achiver of sanatation.
Very difficult to put on.  Once on your hand it is okay but it takes a lot of work to get it on and often tears in the process.  Would not buy this product again.

These gloves run small. Wouldn't fit me or my husband, we have always fit a medium with no issues. I have a hard time getting these on as they are smaller than most, really tight. Had to order others as we can't use these.

There is NO stretch to them at all!  If you have medium sized hands, if you HAVE to order them, order large or your hand will either barely fit or not at all!  I ordered a few boxes and now stuck with them until I run out!  VERY disappointed!

These gloves are good for a shopping trip or painting rocks. I've tried to use the gloves for cleaning but the gloves rip easily. I now wear 2 pair at a time. A double-glove prevents tears, but you're using twice as many.

Hands down the poorest quality gloves I’ve ordered. They tear SO easily! I don’t have large hands and I had to use baby powder to get them on without tearing. I’m a caregiver and while doing simple asks they would tear between the thumb and index finger, across the knuckles...different places. DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!

These are not those stretchy medical gloves you can pull and snap on. Like you see in movies where the Doctor pulls the glove down the wrist and it snaps back. NOPE NOT THESE. If you even give these the slightest pull they break. I've put on about 15 of them and all of them broke at the wrist trying to get them on. Rip Way to Easily. Waste your money somewhere else.

I bought these as a replacement for the then-sparse latex gloves.  This is a rather poor replacement unless the gloves fit your hands easily.  They do not stretch.  Instead, they just tear at a slight attempt to stretch.  I would not recommend them for any application where tearing of gloves is unacceptable.
Thank you! These are so needed having to pick up supplies for my 80 year old mother during this horrific time. Stay safe stay well! 🙏🏻❤️

I let my housekeeper use these while she's cleaning my house. After cleaning about half my house (it's only 1000 sq ft) her fingers were coming through the gloves! This has never happened with the other ones I bought for her. Do not buy these!

I have this product exquisite rating i saw packaging and i like i like very much very sophisticated for my situation that I immediately excited for use of washing in my spaces of living the dirty ones for cleaning thank you for product  so wonderfully irraproachable that satisfies me very much This is a real review i no live in China.

There’s a reason these are cheap. The nitrile gloves I normally order were unavailable and I needed a substitute. Generally I trust the “Amazon Choice” designation but in this case, it failed me. These are thin, easily torn, and almost impossible to pull all the way onto the fingers without damaging the glove. If a price seems too good to be true, it probably is. These gloves support that theory.

I use disposable gloves daily. I had to purchase these because the ones I have used for years are currently sold out. I am about 30  into this box. So far 9 have ripped...either as I put it on or even as I simply extract one from the box!!  I realize that the high quality gloves NEED to be on the hands of our first responders right now, but these should either not be sold or the price should be greatly reduced to compensate for the amount of them one will have to throw away because of its pitiful quality. Will not be buying these again.

These gloves are terrible.  They are easily the worst I have ever used, and I have been purchasing gloves on Amazon for several years.  I only ordered this brand because my normal choice was out of stock long term secondary to the ongoing pandemic.  These gloves are certainly not heavy duty nor medical grade, as the manufacturer claims.  They run small in size, and they frequently rip during donning.  They are barely adequate for lightweight duty and would not hold up to anything more than that.  Do not buy these if anything else at all is available.

This is my second order of these gloves, I use them for everything!  When I am sanitizing the groceries before bringing them in the house, I have had some tears on the finger tips, if it is a serious task I would suggest wearing two pairs!

Overall quality is not too bad, but I noticed that there were some black dots on some of the gloves, which made me worried, cause that could mean they were repurposed. I don't think I will buy from them again.

I have bought these gloves several times. They rip at the top a lot of times when putting them on. So I put flour on my hands first. They seem to be the cheaper of all I find on Amazon (reason for rebuying).

I do not how this can be best seller. it leaks like crazy and difficult to put on. maybe because of the material. its just horrible. I used Nitrile exam gloves. it works so much better. this one is definitely not good if you touch water.
These are very well made gloves. However, they run very, very small. I ordered medium and could barely get them on. I had to stretch them to make the fit. Make sure you get a size (or two ) larger.
The "medium" size appears to be the equivalent of what other manufactures call "small." Material is thin and tears easily. Not recommended.

This is garbage! Waste of money. I haven’t had the chance to return it. Very poor quality. The picture attached happened to most of them lol. What a waste. I’m more annoyed that my time got wasted ordering and waiting for this.
I could be me, I have large hands , but just doing normal COVID world stuff they rip on me. I had one rip pulling it on my hand, spend a bit more and get decent ones, they are rather lightweight.

WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!  Worst purchased item ever. These glove went to shreds in minutes. Tried several pairs hoping it was just one bad one and after a dozen tries am returning the lot!  Should not be able to cheat people this way. Especially given the double priced item to a superior product that is now not available to non medical yet still essential workers. Not fair!

The material is  hard, rough and unbreathable. After putting the gloves on less than 3 mins, gloves stick on my skin deadly and impossible to slide. It appears steams and gets wet! In less than 10 mins, both my hands appear terrible rash and allergy!!
HORRIBLE. SHOULD HAVE LISTENED TO THE BAD REVIEWS. IT RIPS SO EASILY AND WHILE IM WORKING RANDOM SMALL HOLES STARTED APPEARING.

After ordering several boxes of different types of gloves for protection of my hands from becoming too dry and cracked from hand washing and domestic task in the past few years, I like the Medpride vinyl gloves the best.
Super gloves! I am now so capable working outside in garden, pulling weeds— these gloves don’t even tear with heavy work. Inside- I’m happily doing all the stuff to maintain my home... Thanks!!
I have what I consider small hands. I ordered and was delivered medium. But the fit is so tight and the material so thin that it is difficult to put them on without tearing. Not recommended.
The tear going on. Bad product.

Good gloves for cleaning. I also wear them when I go to shopping during the pandemic. The first time I bought 1 or 2 boxes last year is in the very beginning of COVID-19. They were too expensive. The price is getting reasonable now, so I placed an order again and still have some in home.
They run small.  I wear a medium usually, I could get them on but too snug for me to use my hands.  The vinyl is sturdy but I couldn't use them.  Maybe they'd be better in a bigger size.
These are super super thin. when I am staining wood I have to wear two on each hand. It was all I could get when everybody was selling out of them because of the virus but I won't buy them again
Bought medium size gloves for shopping groceries. I have small hands(usually wear xsmall or small regular gloves). These barely fit and rip. Useless save your money.

The fingers wear through within a few minutes of kitchen work. I have purchased this brand before, so I’m not sure what the difference is, unless they reduced the amount of material to save $. Disappointing.
The glove breaks apart as you try to put it on. Wow... and also the medium is small. I really don't recommend this product for $18.00. Don't get caught out there with this product. Not worth it.
This gloves are good quality. However they are little tight

It seems like several of the gloves within the box has some kind of production fault; mostly involving missing fingers or thumbs. Be careful pulling them on. The vinyl doesn't seem to be as forgiving as nitrile gloves. Too much pulling on the cuff will cause a tear.

Great product to have on hand with showing properties. I go in and out of homes and having this product on hand is worth every penny.  The homeowner feels safe and so do I. The gloves are durable, latex-free.
They do the job; just be careful with putting them on because they aren't as elastic and durable as nitrile gloves. Once they're on though, I haven't had a problem with ripping.

These gloves were terrible.  They would rip at the wrist during application.  While wearing, they would rip at fingers.  very difficult to get on -- felt to small but once one the fitment was okay.  Biggest waste of money, look elsewhere.

I have to use gloves to wash dishes and other household chores.  By the time I finish washing a small amount of dishes the gloves are leaking.  One time use only.  I can't even finish cleaning up the kitchen.
...they offer the protection I need for chores at home including use for medical treatments to skin cuts and abrasions as well as washing dishes and cleaning up behind kitty.
I am a woman with a wide palm and short fingers and they fit me perfectly.  But they do tear quite easily.  My husband tried to wear them and they were way too small for him.
very tight fit, sized incorrectly as medium when laid out to other gloves they are smaller than the smalls i have on hand. puncture at fingers easily due to the thinness and small size
i searched many brands to find out what my criteria should be. powder ,material, cost, and delivery. also country of origin. i chose this brand. one benefit of amazon is the education.
I have ordered this product before. I need to get a different size next time because these are a little tight in my hands M is too small. XL is too large. Next time I’ll try L.
I order medium because I like a little movement for my hand in these gloves.  Gloves stay on while shopping, I have used them to clean at home as well.  Happy with these as I have tried a few others.
I use them when I do oil paintings to protect my hands from any chemicals in the paint and have had no issues with paint/solvents getting through.  I would recommend them.
They rip at the cuffs when you pull them on or take them off.  Have bought other brands and did not experience this problem.  Definitely will Not be ordering these again.
These gloves are very poor quality and thin it breaks when I put it on.  Not nitrile gloves, not flexible.
First off I didn’t know it was clear gloves which means they always are easy to tear. Wasted multiple gloves just trying to put them on because they rip. Never buying again.
These gloves have a more tapered fit then other gloves. The thickness is adequate and not easily punctured. A good buy and an essential purchase for Covid-19 times.
These are terrible. Rip when putting on. Felt so thin on skin. Do not waste any money on these.
Poor quality, hard to put on and tears easyly!

Good value for the price. I use them for resin and candle making. They could be a little stronger and thicker because if you get resin on them you can feel it burn a little bit, and they rip very easily.
These gloves are not very thick, they do the job, but they are lose around the wrist and break easily. You have to change often. I use them for cleaning around the house.

These work well an hour work environment and are much tougher than the latex . We will be experimenting with size though. Mediums do not work for a large percentage of our people. We will be trying larges next

These are exactly what I wanted for trips to the supermarket and big box stores. I have ordered these twice and recommend them. The medium size fits me perfectly and they’re easy to put on and remove.
These gloves are on the thicker side without any “give”, and have a rolled cuff. They run a bit small. However, they do the job! Didn’t tear when I wore them.
These gloves are very thin and tear quite easily. I wish they lasted longer!
These gloves don’t seem to be as thick and the size medium. Seems to be a little snugger than the blue gloves as the blue gloves , but they get the job done.

Certainly one of the worst gloves I’ve seen. They are thin, which is actually good, but not durable at all. Putting them on 3 times out of 5 results in a need to get another glove as the first one rips apart.
I always wear medium, so that's what I ordered. These are way too small, more like size small. Very hard to get on. Plus they tear easily. Don't waste your money on these!
The first two times using, I put a hole in glove.  I use for things like cooking, applying skin tanner.  I will not return, but will not purchase again.

These gloves are durable and thick enough for what I need. They are expensive but all PPE has gotten outrageous since March so no surprise there. Prior to this I could easily find gloves for $7-$9 per box.

Unfortunately my employees are saying the gloves are low quality and get ripped quickly. We are in delivery business and if gloves get ripped after first few deliveries, it becomes challenging wearing such gloves. Some other brands last a whole day.
I work with horses and they are great for any number of things. I also use them for hsndling fresh and dried chiles for latin cooking. They are nice!
These gloves seem very good for protection of hands and for protection from surface microbes. They fit a bit tight, but perhaps the medium is a bit smaller than some brands' medium-size gloves.
I use this to change adult diapers.  Gloves are strong and does not tear.  Gloves fit comfortably and it makes it easy to get the job done quickly.

Unfortunately 9 out of 10 pairs of gloves breaks at the wrist. They are not as strong or stretchy as some disposable gloves I have bought. I am disappointed because the other disposable gloves I have bought worked well and I bought two boxes of these. I did not reorder the previous gloves because they were not available when I needed them, an these were available quickly.
They arrived timely. They appear to be as described. However, cannot assess thickness or durability. Hopefully they are reliable and safe for the pandemic.

These gloves are fine if wearing a short period of time and for a simple task. Other than that they are useless. When using them to clean and wipe down products and surfaces, they tear very easily around the fingertips and knuckles. Can even feel the disinfectant (like isopropyl alcohol or lysol/clorox wipes) bleed thru onto your hands and fingers. Even if you double them. No protection.
Did not rip while pouring paint and the fingertips didn’t flap all over as I have short fingers, I ordered a medium, also easy to get on and off.
It has an odd texture. Occasionally, it will rip when I try to put that on. Otherwise it does the job and has better durability than other inexpensive gloves on the market.

I was a little concerned because it turned out I ordered the wrong size (medium) for my hands. These are a tight fit for me. However, using a little care, I am still able to get them on without tearing so I consider them durable and sturdy. I would recommend them.
EVEN THOUGH I BOUGHT THE APPROPRIATE SIZE, THEY WERE SMALLER THAN EXPECTED AND TIGHT TO PUT ON.  MAKING IT WORK, BUT NOT REALLY HAPPY OVERALL.
The gloves fit well but they don't stretch much so they don't fit as tightly as medical gloves would.  It works but I probably won't buy again.

Clear and just right for my small/med sized hands. They are fine for around the house cleaning and sanitation purposes. I just wish Amazon Delivery Drivers would put the items in a position where I can open my front door to get the packages.

These have a tendency to tear at the wrist when pulling them on if you are not careful, but buying a larger size would probably be helpful.  I only use to prepare meatloaf or to apply capsaicin cream, so perfect for my needs.

Worked well enough for intended purpose. Used for cleaning, surface disinfecting, and washing dishes. Helps to prevent drying and cutting of hands after so much hand washing and dealing with chemicals, etc.
These gloves work well for the price. They sometimes rip when you put them on but not always. They do protect your hands and I like that they are clear.
Works well for cleaning and I also use when picking up dog poop in backyard (not everything can be picked up with pooper scooper) and they are durable and comfortable.
Run small and tip easy!
I prefer the nitrile gloves but they have been hard to find.  These don’t fit that well and will rip at the wrists  my hands aren’t dry. I like this brand, and would give the nitrile ones 5 stars
They break easily. Really thin material it's feels like cheap plastic. Of the 100, 98 of them broke between the fingers. Not recommend it.

I had high hopes after opening the box, my biggest issues with them is they rip so easily.  Almost every time I put one on, it rips, luckily its only near wrist area so I could finish using it since my hand is still covered, but sadly I won't be reordering.
DID NOT LIKE THEM
These gloves are very thin and brittle. They tear very easily. I thought I had the wrong size, but bigger gloves still rip two of three times.

Had to reorder in medium rather than the small I ordered first. I always wear small in the medical type exam gloves but these run too small. They are fine for home use. All gloves are overpriced right now.
Perfect gloves for this pandemic. They are not too thick but not too thin. I would buy them again. I would recommend ordering a size up because if they are too tight they will tear easily.
I use these for pour painting which is very messy. I have never had a tear or any problems and my hands stay clean. I would highly recommend.
I ordered medium size based on the other reviews that I read and it works fine. Only thing I noticed you cant put a pair if your hands are wet.
...even with short trimmed nails. I use disposable gloves for a variety of light chores and these did NOT hold up. A waste of money and I don’t recommend.
Does not really work for me. Was broken while I was cleaning my kitchen. Also, not really water proof at the bottom (wide open).
The gloves were great I brought them for my mom but I had to test them out first before I give them to my mom, the gloves passed the test. Thank you!👍🏿👍🏿
Care of senior family member with health problems.. insuring safety of all those within house.  Plus daughter uses at work to prevent any contamination from work to home.  Masks and gloves!
expensive and rips too easy...$20 a box....I should have waited because Costco had gloves a week later for $10 a box and thicker quality
Ordered these due to Coronavirus. I have health issues and needed some gloves I could easily put on and take off. These are like that and the cost was very comparable for gloves to throw away.
These were a little smaller than I expected. Most of them tear when putting them on. If you have a very small hand they may not be so bad.
have been buying surgical gloves at Costco for years and love them.  These are not as stretchy so are sort of baggy on my hands.
These gloves are a bit thicker and therefore sturdier, and fit much better than the gloves I've been using. Like these a lot!
If you want gloves that are easy to get on and flexible you don't want pure vinyl gloves.  If you know you want vinyl gloves this product is satisfactory
I love that these gloves are more substantial  than others I have. They are easy to put on and to take off also. These are a good buy.
these gloves are a big disappointment they are not pliable and therefore, rip when trying to put them on--i will not be purchasing these again!
Gloves are durable but very tight and a struggle to get on. I'm very average size and do not have large hands so I ordered size medium. Next time I know to get size large.
These are good for household use. Great for those with latex and powder allergies. These are vinyl so not much stretch
Too small and trying to put it on is a struggle and keep ripping it when trying to put on. Not that thick and durable.
I order gloves for the aides who take car of my Mother, so I have not seen these myself, but I was told by the aide that they ripped when she was putting them on.
They rip easily, I was putting one on and it rips, good thing I only need them to do easy tasks.. nothing major like body fluids or hazardous stuff.

This glove is very thin. I usually can clean an entire home using 4 gloves that I buy from the dollar tree that are plastic and same size.  I used about 8 gloves and they kept breaking. I wishes I had bought just one box to try them, however I bought two and I’m very disappointed.
With the Covid 19 hazards of touching contaminated things, I wear these when filling my gas tank and going to stores.
A little small. I usually use X-small in another brand and these are a medium and they are a little too small for me.
These suck! I ended up not using them because I couldn’t even get them on my hand without them ripping. I tried blowing them up to stretch them a little and they still ripped.
so the gloves are okay but the box was in horrible shape. it was smushed and opened. which then I had to wonder where have the gloves been.

Good gloves. Make sure you get the right size. I ordered medium. They fit my hands just fine, but they don’t have much stretch/give. If they’re too small for you, you won’t be able to make them work for you.
Tear literally every time you take them off.  They also seem to leave a smell on my hands.  Not my favorite product.
First, they’re VINYL GLOVES NOT LATEX. Second, the very first one ripped! Very poor quality. Unfortunately I’ll be returning these.
My family turned out positive for Covid and these have helped me keep my kids healthy. I wear them to prepare their food and clean. They are thick and comfortable to wear would definitely recommend
I rip them when I pull them on. In their defense I have medium length fingernails. They could be longer past the wrist. Acetone destroys them.

I use these gloves for everyday tasks. Laundry, dishes, cleaning, cleaning out my car or if you need to use your hands for something that is unsanitary or dirty. We use our hands so much might as well protect them and reduce over washing your hands for all these tasks. But obviously you still need to wash your hands during the day though. Over all great buy for a decent price.
My first delivery was damaged and the second has gloves that break with little pull. I would not repurchase.
Awful fit and tears easily.

These run very small. I have small hands & the mediums fit daily well... they aren’t tight but they are not lose either. My husband put one on & it tore b/c they run small. If you wear a medium get a large.

They do what I want them to do... Protect my hands on small jobs around the house. They do tear a little bit easily... But what are we supposed to expect from disposable gloves? I would buy these again.
Seriously - worst gloves I ever had. They run small, they rip when you put them on. I think I will just return this, because I can't even use this product.
Make sure you get the correct size because these are very thin and tear very easily. This has a loose fit
Arrived quickly but I tore the first one that I put on in two places.
These gloves are great for all my uses  They are comfortable and I use them and then just toss them away
Works great for the purpose I bought them.  I bought them to use when I grocery shop. Wish everyone did.
These break very easily at the wrist! Worthless when it comes to caring for my boyfriend post surgery.

I use these gloves when I grocery shop and for situations when I am touching product that was handled by other hands or will be handled by others.  I am satisfied with the durability; no gloves have torn.  I have small hands and the medium fits well without being too snug or too large.  I ordered a second box.
Have been buying these since April 2020!  Great product. Gives me a sense of safety when out of house.
These run s  my all and tears easily when you’re trying to put them on. I sit  ll d not recommend them!
This product need improvement especially during this pandemic.
The gloves fit perfectly well and protect your hands real well.  Also, I like how they extend to the wrist.
Mustard have item in those times

While I do believe this is real germ-x, it is not like any other germ-x I have bought. It is extremely watery. If you look at the inactive ingredients you will see that water is the first ingredient (ingredients are listed in order of volume in products) on the older bottle I have bought a few months ago, water is the last inactive ingredient. No wonder this was inexpensive, it is watered down by the manufacturer. Wish I could return it. (New bottle is on the left in the picture, old bottle on the right)

This is a listing for legitimate Germ X made by the actual manufacturer and distributed by Amazon. I was in shock that I got an order of it successfully during this time. It arrived 3 weeks earlier than expected. It is 4 large bottles. I ordered universal pumps for 32oz bottles to use with these bottles. If/when this listing becomes available, trust that you are buying the actual product.

***** UPDATE******  Hi Y'all!  I wanted to give some updated information to my review below.  I ordered a second batch of this, and it was different.  The cap was mint green (not white), and the label was crooked.  The amount of alcohol is different (62% on the mint green cap, and 63% on the white cap).  So.......I called the manufacturer, VIJON, and left a message.  I thought I'd never hear anything, and the sweetest lady called me back in about 3 hours.  She had me read the batch numbers on both bottles, and said they are both legit.  She said they ran out of white caps, and had to switch to green caps.  She said they are producing hand sanitizer about 24 hours a day, and they are getting them out as fast as they can, so the labels are not perfect.  She also said they do make different formulas of their product, and the difference in alcohol percentage was normal. So I still don't think any of these are fake as long as you bought them from Amazon and not a 3rd party seller.  Hope that helps! I am shocked to see all the folks claiming this is fake.  I do agree the bottles weren't quite as full as I thought they should be, but we should have been paying $24 for this, rather than $18, so I wonder if a machine malfunctioned and didn't fill to the top, and they took that into consideration?? Amazon maybe got a special deal on them?  Mine were sold and shipped from Amazon, and not a 3rd party seller.  Anyway....I don't agree these are fake.  The bottles look fine, labels look legit, product inside seems fine, and smells good.  It's a strong scent of alcohol, but on my hands, I can smell the aloe!  I snagged several orders of these for myself, friends, neighbors, and our office.  Every order I got was the same, and I am pleased.  Especially since they were less than $5 a bottle!

I don't usually write reviews.  I am grateful for the product itself however this is NOT actual Germ-x.  The bottles arrived opened not sealed.  They are not actually filled all the way.  The sanitizer is quite runny.  I will not buy from this seller again.

I can't believe that people are REALLY claiming the authenticity of this Germ-X. The price is absolutely wonderful and great in a time of need to keep around. As a big germaphobe already, I have used Germ-X for years. I did receive one bottle with the top squished and I lost a small amount of sanitizer, which was probably due to poor package handling. The bottles were not sealed but lids tightly screwed and this is normal, even when bought at Walmart they aren't sealed. My bottles weren't filled to the top but no sanitizer I've ever bought has been filled to the top.. The scent is light, sanitizer isn't sticky and provides you with the coverage you need to keep your hands germ free. If you haven't used Germ-X as a child in school or as an adult in your everyday routine, you'll be naive to others claims. And unless your bottle is turned upside down in the box, even with improper package handling, it isn't possible that every last ounce was emptied out. If you still aren't convinced, if you have it and don't believe it's real then just take a sniff and you'll quickly smell the alcohol. It is the regular consistency of hand sanitizer as well.

This product shipped promptly. I read reviews and got nervous about the authenticity. Called as soon as I have the lady the batch number she told me the bottle size and percent Alcohol. She also said the formula is different from old bottles but it is a genuine product. I went to a "germX" website and asked her she said it's a third party site so they don't have anything to do with it listing the old formula in the ingredients. Let's all relax the system still works. GermX customer service was great but I felt stupid for calling, it's real. To address the bottles being sealed.... Never have I bought germX at Walmart and the bottle was sealed, people are just paying attention now when they were oblivious before. Hope this helps.

A lot of reviewers  have made comments about the authenticity of this item. Mine arrived in an Amazon box and inside was a sealed box from the manufacturer, Germ X.  No issues, no leaking, no half empty bottles, or spilling of product. If you are able to order this product I wouldn’t hesitate, it will probably come before your promised time frame. It’s a great deal. I will be using liter pumps  to dispense.
This is great Sanitizer of high quality to get in such crisis, specially brands like Purell or Germx. I would like to thanks Amazon for speedy delivery. Highly recommended.

Wow... I am so thankful I was finally able to get sanitizer. Just like another reviewer I was doubting if it was going to come at all. Ordered 4/22 Deliver today 5/16. So it took a while but considering the situation I can’t complain. My bottles were not broken nor half empty, packaging was well done. A smaller box fully taped inside a bigger amazon box. One had a few ounces missing but again I will not complain. The price was just phenomenal less than $20 for all! I feel like I won the jackpot. As far as the smell I actually like it. So definitely 2 thumbs up in general.

This is legit! This is the real stuff! I don’t know why the other reviews say otherwise, but the ones I received were authentic! Ordered 4/21, didn't ship until 5/12 and arrived in 2 day prime shipping. THIS IS FOR THE SOLD AND SHIPPED BY AMAZON. If you bought this from Amazon as the seller and it came with a smaller Germ-X manufacturer sealed labelled box containing all 4 bottles, YOU'RE GOOD. It's the real deal. All bottles were filled level and even, exp dates (2022) and labels were all stamped uniform, there were some air bubbles present with the labeling, but that's normal. Smells awful but that's hand sanitizer. There's no plastic safety wrap or inner seal, so for those who got (double) crushed boxes, peeling labels, leaky uneven bottles, I don't know who you can blame. Imagine trying to buy this in store then where anything can be easily tampered then? I don't remember anything having seals. I'm very happy with this purchase, now to find some pumps and mini bottles.
I was supposed to get 24 Germ-X hand sanitizers and only received 20. I ordered these for our Cross Country Team and now I don’t have enough for each runner.

This is clearly counterfeit, smells odd and bottle caps don't even match the bottles appropriately. I cannot trust that the correct alcohol was used to create this, so I'm forced to get a refund from Amazon and throw the product in the garbage since it is not returnable.

First off, I only received 3 bottles not 4. All of the bottles were open, leaking, and caked in dirt. There is even what I’m assuming is dirt floating in one of the bottles. I highly doubt this is actual germx. This is not returnable and getting a refund looks impossible. Do not buy into this SCAM.
This is not real GermX. It smells like a really bad cheap perfume. It’s just terrible. And they do not allow returns.

I wish I could NOT give a star... Total disappointment!!!!! Just arrived today and I was so excited, as the package arrived 2 weeks before it was supposed to. Then the disappointment set in after opening the box, I could see right away that these 4 bottles are NOT the normal Germ-X I have bought in the stores before the crisis.  They were watery and the smell is different compared to the ones I just had bought at a well-known grocery store a few weeks ago. Now I'm out of the $$ as you cannot return this item due safety reasons, flammable, etc (but they can be delivered... ??).  How can I be confident that my order is safe to use?  There was NO seals on any of the bottles and the caps were barely on there, this just DOES NOT look nor smell the same as of other bottles of Germ-X I have.  I will not be using this crap on my hands, just can't trust what may be in these bottles.  With all the news media showing certain companies/brands adding methanol, who can trust that is not in these?  AGAIN, NO SEALS ON BOTTLES. It's just NOT worth the risk. Now just one more unknown product going into our landfills.
This is not the real Germ-X.  This product stinks and  I would not recommend it to anyone.
FAKE. Do not purchase. It is not the original GermX Hand sanitizer. FAKE. FAKE. FAKE. The will ship to you no problem, but will not allow to return because it’s a “flammable product. FAKE PRODUCT!

I’ve read all the bad reviews and want to chime in. Yes; this hand sanitizer is watery compared to precious Germ X. Mine also didn’t come with a seal under the cap (clear cap). It also doesn’t smell amazing at all. However, I SO want it to be legit so I called the customer complaint line from the back of the label. Based on the lot number, they were able to verify my product, they knew the expire date (which matches the bottles). They explained that they have two “original” formulas and this one is simply different ingredients but equally effective. Anyway, I feel better now, but def agree it arrives looking a little suspect.
Out of the four bottles contained in this pack, two of them were broken and leaking when I received them today. The system won’t let me ask for a replacement either.
I ❤️ GermX!

After reading the reviews of spilled and possibly fake contents, I was pretty worried about what I would get.  I received my order today (after waiting nearly a month), and it's for real.  The bottles came in a sealed Germ X box, and there was no leakage.  They are flip tops, and the bottle are not sealed, but they aren't sealed if you find them on a store shelf either.  My cousin got a 32-ounce bottle at Target, and he verified that.  The bottles held slightly different amounts, but the one with the least fluid had as much as the picture my cousin sent.  Also, I had talked to Vi-Jon the manufacturer, when I saw the review, and the person told me to look for a seven-digit batch number in black. probably starting with "04," followed by the expiration date, and all the bottles had that.  They are all from the same batch.  It feels fine and smells good.  So, after all that, I'm very satisfied and these bottles will last me for a very long time.
All 4 bottles were open and wasting out. How?! Very disappointed in this after waiting a month for this.

Product was delivered earlier than expected. Product is exactly as described. I'm very happy with this purchase considering how hard it is getting hand santizer,and the price is grrreat! Thank you Amazon! This will last my family awhile as I have older parents that really need this!
Definitely not germ x hand sanitizer. Smells completely different.
